titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Edward J. Rozek papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Rachel Yamada and Jim Sam

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-05-18T15:18-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: Reformatted audio descriptions added for 1975 Institute Tapes, Conference on Detente, and a few other miscellaneous recordings by Jim Sam.
Reformatted audio descriptions added from boxes 107-108.

physdesc.extent: 114 manuscript boxes, 36 card file boxes, 1 oversize box, 3 motion picture film reels

did.abstract: Correspondence, writings, printed matter, and audiovisual material relating to communism and to political conditions in Eastern Europe. Includes records of the Institute for the Study of Economic and Political Freedom.

origination.label: Contributor
origination.corpname: Institute for the Study of Economic and Political Freedom.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Use copies of some sound recordings in this collection are available for immediate access. To listen to other sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Edward J. Rozek papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2014.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Born in Poland in 1918, Edward Rozek fought first for Poland and then for the Polish Tenth Armoured Brigade during World War II. Following the war, Rozek moved to the United States in 1948 and attended Harvard University, where he earned his BA, MA, and PhD. After graduating, Rozek accepted a position at the University of Colorado, where he remained a professor for his entire academic career. At the University of Colorado, Rozek founded and directed both the Edward Teller Center (later renamed the Center for Science, Technology and Political Thought) and the Institute for the Study of Economic and Political Freedom.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, writings, letters to the editor, printed matter, and audiovisual material relating to communism and to political conditions in Eastern Europe. Includes records of the Institute for the Study of Economic and Political Freedom as well as for the Center for Science, Technology and Political Thought. Of note are the materials from a prominent court case from 1978 to 1985, in which the University of Colorado sued Edward Rozek for embezzlement and misuse of Institute funds.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Teller examines the war between Japan and the United States during World War II, especially in regards to the atomic bomb. He argues the United States should not have used the bomb, that it should have simply demonstrated it without human casualties.

Following, he examines foreign influences in Southeast Asia, focusing on French, Japanese, and American involvement in the area. During this segment, he mentions what might happen under McGovern should he win the election, indicating the talk is from sometime in 1972.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A conference on physics and energy systems with several speakers.
Please note that each cassette exists in the Archives in triplicate. All three copies have similar sound quality, which, unfortunately, is poor due to distortion.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p:
Part 01: May 19. Conference introduction: Brett, morning speeches: Lamm, Harrigan, Herst (part 1)
Part 02: May 19. Herst (cont'd); Draine; panel: Crowley, Drachman, Rockwell, Shepard (part 1)
Part 03: May 19. Morning Panelist Statement: Shepherd(part 2)
Part 04: May 19. Morning Panelist Statement: Daggett, panel discussion, Q&A, Luncheon (part 1)
Part 05: May 19. Luncheon (part 2), afternoon speeches: Moses (part 1)
Part 06: May 19. Afternoon speeches: Moses (part 2), Berg (part 1)
Part 07: May 19. Afternoon speeches: Berg (part 2), McClaughry, panelists: Bermingham, Draine (part 1)
Part 08: May 19. Afternoon panelist statement: Draine (part 2), panel discussion
Part 09: May 19. Afternoon panel discussion (part 2), Q&A
Part 10: May 19. Entire evening session.
Part 11: May 20. Morning speeches: Hoegh, Thomas, McCloskey (part 1)
Part 12: May 20. Morning session. McCloskey (part 2), Bannister
Part 13: May 20. Morning panelist statements, panel discussion Q&A (part 1)
Part 14: May 20. 10:15, Q&A
Part 15: May 20. Morning: Q&A (last part), afternoon speeches: Roth, McCredie, Orell (part 1)
Part 16: May 20. Afternoon speeches: Orell (part 2), Godfrey (part 1)
Part 17: May 20. Afternoon speeches: Godfrey (part 2), Aspinall: Summary

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Part 1: Bertram Wolfe on the ambiguity of revolution. He speaks about the actual results of revolutions in contrast to the public aspirations of the revolutionaries. He focuses on the Soviet revolution, Lenin, and Stalin.

did.unittitle: A lecture on communism in China,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Lord Lindsay examines communism in China, the philosophy of Mao Zedong, and how they apply to the rest of the world, especially the Soviet Union and the United States.
